src/lib/components/TiledViewer.react.js.description:
ExampleComponent is an example component.
It takes a property, `label`, and
displays it.
It renders an input with the property `value`
which is editable by the user.

id.description: The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

backgroundClassName.description: The class name for the background.

closeOnSelect.description: Whether to close the viewer on select.

apiKey.description: The API key for the Tiled viewer.

bearerToken.description: The bearer token for the Tiled viewer.

buttonModeText.description: The text for the button mode.

contentClassName.description: The class name for the content.

enableStartupScreen.description: Whether to enable the startup screen.

isPopup.description: Whether the viewer is a popup.

selectedLinks.description: The content sent into the callback function from Tiled.

setProps.description: The callback function to call on select.

singleColumnMode.description: Whether to use single column mode.

tiledBaseUrl.description: The base URL for the tiled viewer.

isFullWidth.description: Whether to use full width of the parent element.

inButtonModeShowApiKeyInput.description: Whether to show the API key input in button mode.

inButtonModeShowReverseSortInput.description: Whether to show the reverse sort input in button mode.

inButtonModeShowSelectedData.description: Whether to show the selected data in button mode.

reverseSort.description: Whether to reverse the sort order.

initialPath.description: The initial path for the Tiled viewer.

showPlanName.description: Whether to show the plan name in columns for BlueskyRuns.

showPlanStartTime.description: Whether to show the plan start time in columns for BlueskyRuns.

pageLimit.description: The page limit to be shown in columns.

reloadLastItemOnStartup.description: Whether to reload the last available selected item on component startup.

includeAuthTokensInSelectCallback.description: Whether to include auth tokens in the select item callback. If tokens are not found in local storage, the values will be null.
